name: Warped Echo
desc: The next source of damage is reduced by 10% and spread into 3 (+1 per stack) hits . All echoed damage is non-lethal except for the final hit. Recharges every 15s .
notes:
The Warped Echo is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion. 
The next source of damage dealt to the holder will be reduced by 10% and split into 3 "echoed" hits (+1 per stack) dealt in 0.75 second intervals. All echoed hits are non-lethal except for the last one.
After splitting damage once, the item goes on cooldown for 15 seconds.


== Notes ==
The damage reduction happens after OSP, so you'd end up taking 81% damage instead of 90%.
Due to how One Shot Protection works, Warped Echo can prevent death at above 90% health regardless of how much curse you have.
Curse does not remove OSP, it simply limits damage taken to 100% of your combined health.
As such, at full health, lethal damage is limited, then reduced by 10%, then split into 3 parts, resulting in 90% damage taken.
Even at lower than 90% health, your health regeneration inbetween the echoes may heal you enough to still survive.
Damage increases (such as     ) will increase the damage twice, once when going in and then when echoed.
This allows Warped Echo to still bypass One Shot Protection, as while the initial damage is limited to 90% after the increase, the individual Echoed hits may total over 100% health.
Look out for this interaction when using   Captain's   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike on yourself.
While the Warped Echo is charged, it displays a unique status effect above the health bar and surrounds the holder in a yellow-green bubble.
After taking damage, a new status effect is added and revolving orbs appear around the holder to represent how many echoed hits are remaining.
Split damage that has not been dealt yet is displayed in dark red on players' health bar.
Unlike other items with cooldowns, such as  Safer Spaces and  Breaching Fin, there is not any status effect to indicate that the Warped Echo is on cooldown.
The status effects on the damage will not be applied a second time.
If the damage is blocked or cancelled (such as by  Tougher Times), Warped Echo will not activate.


== Tips ==
This item can trigger these items multiple times:
 Roll of Pennies
 Tougher Times
 Razorwire
The splitting of damage can give you time to heal and potentially save your life,  Delicate Watches, and/or  Power Elixirs.
The delay allows you to use invinciblity to try and dodge following echoed hits, allowing you to further reduce damage taken. This also allows you to avoid death by becoming invincible during the lethal hit.
